commit_message:
Switch from django string_concat to format_lazy

string_concat was removed in django 2.1 when it reached the end
of it's deprecation cycle. It was removed because the same behavior
can be achieved with format_lazy.

For more details see:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.1/

Change-Id: I5e1c9bdfa1d0e049e0516198abbdb76be1667216
Closes-Bug: #1836671
Partial-Bug: #1789046
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/45/671045/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils.text import format_lazy self.verbose_name = format_lazy('{}{}{}', self.verbose_name, ' ', _("(Quota exceeded)"))
deleted_lines: from django.utils.translation import string_concat self.verbose_name = string_concat(self.verbose_name, ' ', _("(Quota exceeded)"))

subject: Setup framework for IPv6-only deployment verification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-16 20:50:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/3b05c35dee5717994a623b1f84b80df46cb6910b', 'message': "Setup framework for IPv6-only deployment verification

Devstack IPv6 base job 'devstack-IPv6' setup the IPv6 setting
to deploy the services to listen on IPv6 address.

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments',
we will expand this job to do IPv6-only deployments verification.

This commit define the new roles of 'ipv6-only-deployments-verification'
which will be invoked from new playbook 'ipv6-deployement-verification'
as post-run of 'devstack-IPv6' job. This role will do IPv6-only setting
and deployments verification via tools/verify-ipv6-only-deployement.sh
IPv6 verification script can be extended further to perform more checks
and via project specific test case. Those tests will run as part of project
specific child jobs.

The 'devstack-IPv6' job will be used as parent for project specific IPv6-only
job. Those child job can extend the project specific IPv6 verification
by defining new playebook for post-run. That way the base verification
done in 'devstack-IPv6' will still run in addition to project specific
verificaiton and tests run.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-IPv6' post-run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- Child jobs derived from 'devstack-IPv6' will run the IPv6 related test case or
  any further IPv6 deployment verification.

commit_message:
Setup framework for IPv6-only deployment verification

Devstack IPv6 base job 'devstack-IPv6' setup the IPv6 setting
to deploy the services to listen on IPv6 address.

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments',
we will expand this job to do IPv6-only deployments verification.

This commit define the new roles of 'ipv6-only-deployments-verification'
which will be invoked from new playbook 'ipv6-deployement-verification'
as post-run of 'devstack-IPv6' job. This role will do IPv6-only setting
and deployments verification via tools/verify-ipv6-only-deployement.sh
IPv6 verification script can be extended further to perform more checks
and via project specific test case. Those tests will run as part of project
specific child jobs.

The 'devstack-IPv6' job will be used as parent for project specific IPv6-only
job. Those child job can extend the project specific IPv6 verification
by defining new playebook for post-run. That way the base verification
done in 'devstack-IPv6' will still run in addition to project specific
verificaiton and tests run.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-IPv6' post-run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- Child jobs derived from 'devstack-IPv6' will run the IPv6 related test case or
  any further IPv6 deployment verification.

Change-Id: Ie993fac3cc689521f77f8c126ab62b61142e1df9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/52/671152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # # NOTE(gmann): This script is used in 'devstack-ipv6' zuul job to verify that services are deployed # on IPv6 properly or not. This will capture if any service's devstack plugins is missing the # required setting to listen on IPv6 address. This is run as post-run of zuul job so any child # job can expand the IPv6 verification specific to project via defining new post-run script which # will run along with this base script. # If there are more common verification for IPv6 then we can always extent this script. # Keep track of the DevStack directory TOP_DIR=$(cd $(dirname "$0")/.. && pwd) echo $TOP_DIR source $TOP_DIR/stackrc source $TOP_DIR/openrc admin admin function verify_devstack_ipv6_setting { if [[ "$SERVICE_IP_VERSION" != 6 ]]; then echo $SERVICE_IP_VERSION "SERVICE_IP_VERSION is not set to 6 which is must for devstack to deploy services with IPv6 address." exit 1 fi if [[ "$SERVICE_HOST" != "$HOST_IPV6" ]]; then echo "SERVICE_HOST and HOST_IPV6 are set with different value. Do not set SERVICE_HOST explicitly to let Devstack deploy serviecs on iIPv6." exit 1 fi local local_service_host=$(echo $SERVICE_HOST | tr -d []) is_service_host_ipv6=$(python -c 'import oslo_utils.netutils as nutils; print nutils.is_valid_ipv6("'$local_service_host'")') if [[ "$is_service_host_ipv6" != "True" ]]; then echo $SERVICE_HOST "SERVICE_HOST is not ipv6 which means devstack cannot deploy services on IPv6 address." exit 1 fi } function sanity_check_system_ipv6_enabled { system_ipv6_enabled=$(python -c 'import oslo_utils.netutils as nutils; print nutils.is_ipv6_enabled()') if [[ $system_ipv6_enabled != "True" ]]; then echo "IPv6 is disabled in system" exit 1 fi } function verify_service_listen_address_is_ipv6 { endpoints=$(openstack endpoint list -f value -c URL) local all_ipv6=True for endpoint in ${endpoints}; do local endpoint_address=$(echo "$endpoint" | awk -F/ '{print $3}' | awk -F] '{print $1}') endpoint_address=$(echo $endpoint_address | tr -d []) local is_endpoint_ipv6=$(python -c 'import oslo_utils.netutils as nutils; print nutils.is_valid_ipv6("'$endpoint_address'")') if [[ "$is_endpoint_ipv6" != "True" ]]; then all_ipv6=False echo $endpoint ": This is not ipv6 endpoint which means corresponding service is not listening on IPv6 address." continue fi done if [[ "$all_ipv6" == "False" ]]; then exit 1 fi } #First thing to verify if system has IPv6 enabled or not sanity_check_system_ipv6_enabled #Verify whether devstack is configured properly with IPv6 setting verify_devstack_ipv6_setting #Get all registrfed endpoints by devstack in keystone and verify that each endpoints address is IPv6. verify_service_listen_address_is_ipv6

commit_message:
Allow to filter endpoint groups by name

While using the openstack client command, the list on endpoint filters
cannot be filtered by name. This adds an optional parameter on the query
to allow the name to be specified as filter. This fixes the behavior on
OSC to search.

Change-Id: Ia1cbc9f4ded8f2494b1bf7ba5e953be0dfaf11f5
Closes-Bug: #1828565

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Idec4ef20665a4d7d08c3be3ae01a926c95eda6b4
Story: #2005924
Task: #34213

commit_message:
Add dashboard component as new ceph composable service.

This review introduces the CephDashboard service
to allow operators to deploy the new ceph dashboard
along with the other ceph components.
According to the spec we can add the environment
file to reference the template that contains all the
parameters needed to deploy the ceph-dashboard via
ceph-ansible related roles.

Implements: blueprint ceph-dashboard
Change-Id: I1d31cd99823686986cdbd3ac1df184e9457a361e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/78/666578/37 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add ethertype validator for custom ethertype validation

Since the restriction on ethertypes is being raised so that ethertypes
other than IPv4 and IPv6 can be specified in security group rules, add a
validator to ensure that ethertypes will be a valid two octet value.
The ethertype handling is configurable so make sure the validator
handles both possible configuration alternatives: the original style
where only IPv4 and IPv6 are valid, and the new style where any valid
two octet number (or it's string equivalent) works.

Related-Bug: #1832758
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/670203
Change-Id: I900f370f1de20b5137f138e54c5eec2102f77cce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/45/671345/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate_ethertype(ethertype, valid_values=None): """Validates ethertype is a valid ethertype. :param ethertype: Ethertype to validate :returns: None if data is a valid ethertype. Otherwise a human-readable message indicating that the data is not a valid ethertype. """ try: if 0 >= int(ethertype, 16) >= 65535: return None except ValueError: log_warning("Custom ethertype '%(permitted_ethertype)s' " "is not a two octet hexadecimal number.", {'permitted_ethertype': permitted_ethertype}) LOG.warning(log_warning) return log_warning

revisions:

For glance multiple store, image shows backend/store information
in location metadata. It is accessed as a dictionary attribute, which can
lead to KeyError if 'backend' key is not present in location metadata.

To avoid this used get() call of dictionary which returns None if key
is not present in the dictionary.

Change-Id: I0f7fe80f13e79137c7bdaf5ec93e775c88b70cce
Closes-Bug: #1832490
"}]
commit_message:
MultiStore: Avoid potential KeyError in functional tests

For glance multiple store, image shows backend/store information
in location metadata. It is accessed as a dictionary attribute, which can
lead to KeyError if 'backend' key is not present in location metadata.

To avoid this used get() call of dictionary which returns None if key
is not present in the dictionary.

Change-Id: I0f7fe80f13e79137c7bdaf5ec93e775c88b70cce
Closes-Bug: #1832490

deleted_lines: location['url'], location['metadata']['backend'],

in-repo file so that it gets tested by doc8 as well.

commit_message:
Add spec for glusterfs-direcotry-layout-extend-shrink-share

Enable extend and shirnk apis for GlusterFS native driver with
directory mapped layout.

Change-Id: I934b9902fda2f9ee95a91aa9beacab8771ccdc57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-specs refs/changes/84/671884/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Extend and shirnk shared with directory layout ========================================== Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/manila/+spec/glusterfs-direcotry-layout-extend-shrink-share GlusterFS Backend share has two options for share layout: volume mapped, directory mapped. With directory mapped layout, when create a new share It mkdir in glusterfs volume and set quota to the directory. This directory quota can change by using glusterfs set quota commands. Problem description =================== Implement extend and shrink in glusterfs native driver with directory layout. Use Cases ========= We can extend and shrink the glusterfs backend share Proposed change =============== The directory quota can change in GlusterFS by using set quota commands. In shrink_share, We check consumed_space >= new_size and raise exception. ShareShrinkingPossibleDataLoss. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Driver impact ------------- Implemented extend_share(), shrink_share() in glusterfs native driver with dreictory mapped layout. Unit tests will be added too. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: whhan91 Work Items ---------- * Implement extend and shrink share in glusterfs native driver with directory mapped share. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add the unit tests that test_extend_share, test_shrink_share in manila. Documentation Impact ==================== * Update the configuration reference guide ``glusterfs_native_driver``. * Update the development reference guide. * Update the user guide. References ========== GlusterFS direcotry quota: https://docs.gluster.org/en/latest/Administrator%20Guide/Directory%20Quota/

commit_message:
[docs] remove deprecated ubuntu package from installation

keystone package depends already on apache2 and wsgi package:

keystone
  Depends: adduser
 |Depends: apache2
  Depends: <httpd>
    tntnet
    aolserver4-core
    aolserver4-daemon
    apache2
    ebhttpd
    lighttpd
    micro-httpd
    mini-httpd
    nginx-core
    nginx-extras
    nginx-full
    nginx-light
    webfs
    yaws
  Depends: libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3
  Depends: python3-keystone
  Depends: ssl-cert
[...]

Change-Id: I1332df34dd6ee59537d35d93d5c35c2fe96561b2
Related-Bug: #1825111
(cherry picked from commit 0f2b36b2ad50694efa92a39649b778546cca3b31)

subject: Exit 1 when db sync runs before api_db sync
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-17 09:38:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/794f3157f70d3e57f004dea3e11891be065fc18d', 'message': 'Exit 1 when db sync runs before api_db sync

Since cells v2 was introduced, nova operators must run two commands to
migrate the database schemas of nova's databases - nova-manage api_db
sync and nova-manage db sync. It is necessary to run them in this order,
since the db sync may depend on schema changes made to the api database
in the api_db sync. Executing the db sync first may fail, for example
with the following seen in a Queens to Rocky upgrade:

nova-manage db sync
ERROR: Could not access cell0.
Has the nova_api database been created?
Has the nova_cell0 database been created?
Has "nova-manage api_db sync" been run?
Has "nova-manage cell_v2 map_cell0" been run?
Is [api_database]/connection set in nova.conf?
Is the cell0 database connection URL correct?
Error: (pymysql.err.InternalError) (1054, u"Unknown column
        'cell_mappings.disabled' in 'field list'") [SQL: u'SELECT
cell_mappings.created_at AS cell_mappings_created_at,
cell_mappings.updated_at AS cell_mappings_updated_at,
cell_mappings.id AS cell_mappings_id, cell_mappings.uuid AS
cell_mappings_uuid, cell_mappings.name AS cell_mappings_name,
cell_mappings.transport_url AS cell_mappings_transport_url,
cell_mappings.database_connection AS
cell_mappings_database_connection, cell_mappings.disabled AS
cell_mappings_disabled \nFROM cell_mappings \nWHERE
cell_mappings.uuid = %(uuid_1)s \n LIMIT %(param_1)s'] [parameters:
{u'uuid_1': '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000', u'param_1': 1}]
(Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/2j85)

Despite this error, the command actually exits zero, so deployment tools
are likely to continue with the upgrade, leading to issues down the
line.

This change modifies the command to exit 1 if the cell0 sync fails.

Change-Id: Iff2a23e09f2c5330b8fc0e9456860b65bd6ac149
Closes-Bug: #1832860

are likely to continue with the upgrade, leading to issues down the

commit_message:
Exit 1 when db sync runs before api_db sync

Since cells v2 was introduced, nova operators must run two commands to
migrate the database schemas of nova's databases - nova-manage api_db
sync and nova-manage db sync. It is necessary to run them in this order,
since the db sync may depend on schema changes made to the api database
in the api_db sync. Executing the db sync first may fail, for example
with the following seen in a Queens to Rocky upgrade:

nova-manage db sync
ERROR: Could not access cell0.
Has the nova_api database been created?
Has the nova_cell0 database been created?
Has "nova-manage api_db sync" been run?
Has "nova-manage cell_v2 map_cell0" been run?
Is [api_database]/connection set in nova.conf?
Is the cell0 database connection URL correct?
Error: (pymysql.err.InternalError) (1054, u"Unknown column
        'cell_mappings.disabled' in 'field list'") [SQL: u'SELECT
cell_mappings.created_at AS cell_mappings_created_at,
cell_mappings.updated_at AS cell_mappings_updated_at,
cell_mappings.id AS cell_mappings_id, cell_mappings.uuid AS
cell_mappings_uuid, cell_mappings.name AS cell_mappings_name,
cell_mappings.transport_url AS cell_mappings_transport_url,
cell_mappings.database_connection AS
cell_mappings_database_connection, cell_mappings.disabled AS
cell_mappings_disabled \nFROM cell_mappings \nWHERE
cell_mappings.uuid = %(uuid_1)s \n LIMIT %(param_1)s'] [parameters:
{u'uuid_1': '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000', u'param_1': 1}]
(Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/2j85)

Despite this error, the command actually exits zero, so deployment tools
are likely to continue with the upgrade, leading to issues down the
line.

This change modifies the command to exit 1 if the cell0 sync fails.

This change also clarifies this ordering in the upgrade and nova-manage
documentation, and adds information on exit codes for the command.

Change-Id: Iff2a23e09f2c5330b8fc0e9456860b65bd6ac149
Closes-Bug: #1832860

commit_message:
Add call_retry for ModelBuilder for error recovery

Add call_retry method for ModelBuilder classes along with configuration
options. This allows ModelBuilder classes to reattempt any failed calls
to external services such as Nova or Ironic.

Change-Id: Ided697adebed957e5ff13b4c6b5b06c816f81c4a

commit_message:
Fix _make_connection_url

After support uWSGI[1], Watcher endpoint changed from http://ip:port
to http://ip/infra-optim. method _make_connection_url in HTTPClient
class can't return the correct url. This patch fixed it.
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666779/

Change-Id: I77e610cd6781b252327a49aa5cd5bc63d395bf91
Closes-Bug: #1837186

commit_message:
Replace human_id with name in grafana doc

This patch does two things:

1. replace instance's human_id with name.
2. remove ComputeNode human_id.

Now name field in Watcher Compute Data Model is availible.
Use name is better than human_id. For the reason, please see[1].

[1]. https://bugs.launchpad.net/watcher/+bug/1833665

Change-Id: I04f40e7d2a2bda48e9a362f9d0b23f449c40324e

commit_message:
Optimize SchedulerReportClient.delete_resource_provider

This is used to optimize the SchedulerReportClient
delete_resource_provider method when deleting a compute
node and its related resource provider which happens
in both the API when a compute service is deleted and
in the compute service in the update_available_resource
method for orphan nodes (so the new InstanceList query
method needs to be remotable).

The actual DB query stuff in here is tested in the
nova.tests.functional.wsgi.test_services code.

Change-Id: Id033e8f95f853ccfc34bd350be6df11c1bfb1b7d
Related-Bug: #1811726

commit_message:
Use the insecure registry w/o port with podman on RedHat 8 and above

Remove the OSP consition and modify the conditions to use the
podman formulation - ie: no port number, if the deployment is
on RHEL 8 or newer releases.

Change-Id: I72d45c886b652b878060c0e85a6ec6e46f60dc09

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: I2c87490faba283c4d4bcb3fbe386955a49601945

subject: Ensure that only cloud admins are neutron admins
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-19 13:12:16.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/neutron_api_utils.py', 'templates/queens/00-admin.json', 'unit_tests/test_neutron_api_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api/commit/e03501dee1a43fd264780966e7831c96c0279232', 'message': "Ensure that only cloud admins are neutron admins

When determining if a user is an admin the default neutron policy
file only checks if a user has the 'admin'  role. It does not check
what that role is applied to.

The problem is illustrated by the following scenario: A cloud
admin creates a new domain, then creates a new project within that
domain. The cloud admin wants to delegate the maintenance of the
new project to userA so she grants them admin on the new project.
UserA is now a cloud admin from Neutrons pov.

To fix this issue a policy override file is added which checks that
the user is admin either against the admin project (as defined by
keystone) or the service project.

Change-Id: If4c5b0c1ab7bf2c75e911e77531d442d417a1231
Closes-Bug: 1830536
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that only cloud admins are neutron admins

When determining if a user is an admin the default neutron policy
file only checks if a user has the 'admin'  role. It does not check
what that role is applied to.

The problem is illustrated by the following scenario: A cloud
admin creates a new domain, then creates a new project within that
domain. The cloud admin wants to delegate the maintenance of the
new project to userA so she grants them admin on the new project.
UserA is now a cloud admin from Neutrons pov.

To fix this issue a policy override file is added which checks that
the user is admin either against the admin project (as defined by
keystone) or the service project.

Change-Id: If4c5b0c1ab7bf2c75e911e77531d442d417a1231
Closes-Bug: 1830536
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api refs/changes/21/671721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added RedHat-8 release file

In order to speed up the work on RHEL-8, we need a release
file for RedHat-8 so that standalone jobs works.

Set distro_deps_repo_name: deps
Enable RHUI repos as it is disabled by default.
Use rhel-binary for container tag

Change-Id: I5eb91e39cf76c79af8704bf341d003e3a3a6b866
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ansible to delorean-current repo

tripleo-ansible needs to be consumed like other
tripleo packages from delorean current repo as
the promoted one from current-tripleo repo might
not be compatible with other tripleo packages from
current.

Change-Id: I243b0e7c8a1276257ec168a0059e81a36ea7fc75

commit_message:
Enable os_tempest for master multinode jobs

As overcloud clouds.yaml support landed in Tripleo for train
release and os_tempest ansible role is used for running
tempest. Multinode container job runs for other releases also
so it updates the fs010 to run os_tempest for master only.

Closes-Bug: #1837019

Change-Id: I96925574858223348faf35521fb2afdf7710e0db
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/47/671447/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Settings for os_tempest run_tempest: >- {% if release not in ['queens', 'rocky', 'stein'] -%} false {%- else -%} true {%- endif -%} use_os_tempest: true tempest_test_whitelist: - 'tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps'
deleted_lines: run_tempest: true

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Story: #2005924
Task: #34234

commit_message:
Add a scenario test for spare pool

This patch adds a scenario test for testing amphora spare pool feature.
It adds new check jobs to test against master as well as stable
branches.

Change-Id: I87249017453628e3d2cd320a02677d81397f1b26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin refs/changes/88/634988/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - job: name: octavia-v2-dsvm-spare-pool parent: octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario vars: tempest_test_regex: ^octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.spare_pool_scenario.v2 devstack_local_conf: post-config: $OCTAVIA_CONF: house_keeping: spare_amphora_pool_size: 1 - job: name: octavia-v2-dsvm-py2-spare-pool parent: octavia-v2-dsvm-spare-pool vars: devstack_localrc: USE_PYTHON3: False

subject: Delete resource providers for all nodes when deleting compute service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-05-03 19:28:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/641fe32c47c281fdfff62349b97d95c3cc989501', 'message': "Delete resource providers for all nodes when deleting compute service

Change I7b8622b178d5043ed1556d7bdceaf60f47e5ac80 started deleting the
compute node resource provider associated with a compute node when
deleting a nova-compute service. However, it would only delete the
first compute node associated with the service which means for an
ironic compute service that is managing multiple nodes, the resource
providers were not cleaned up in placement. This fixes the issue by
iterating all the compute nodes and cleaning up their providers.
Note this could be potentially a lot of nodes, but we don't really
have many good options here but to iterate them and clean then up
one at a time. If anything fails in that loop, we won't have deleted
the compute service record so the user could retry the operation.

Change-Id: I9e852e25ea89f32bf19cdaeb1f5dac8f749f5dbc
Closes-Bug: #1811726
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-05-03 19:33:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fbbe5579981b5045ce8b2f8e34da2c57ca86b6e7', 'message': "Delete resource providers for all nodes when deleting compute service

Change I7b8622b178d5043ed1556d7bdceaf60f47e5ac80 started deleting the
compute node resource provider associated with a compute node when
deleting a nova-compute service. However, it would only delete the
first compute node associated with the service which means for an
ironic compute service that is managing multiple nodes, the resource
providers were not cleaned up in placement. This fixes the issue by
iterating all the compute nodes and cleaning up their providers.
Note this could be potentially a lot of nodes, but we don't really
have many good options here but to iterate them and clean them up
one at a time. If anything fails in that loop, we won't have deleted

Change-Id: I9e852e25ea89f32bf19cdaeb1f5dac8f749f5dbc
Closes-Bug: #1811726
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-06-13 19:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_services.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1811726-multi-node-delete-2ba17f02c6171fbb.yaml', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/services.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/650fe118d128f09f78552b82abc114bb4b84930e', 'message': "Delete resource providers for all nodes when deleting compute service

Change I7b8622b178d5043ed1556d7bdceaf60f47e5ac80 started deleting the
compute node resource provider associated with a compute node when
deleting a nova-compute service. However, it would only delete the
first compute node associated with the service which means for an
ironic compute service that is managing multiple nodes, the resource
providers were not cleaned up in placement. This fixes the issue by
iterating all the compute nodes and cleaning up their providers.
Note this could be potentially a lot of nodes, but we don't really
have many good options here but to iterate them and clean them up
one at a time.

Note that this is best-effort but because of how the
SchedulerReportClient.delete_resource_provider method ignores
ResourceProviderInUse errors, and we could have stale allocations
on the host for which delete_resource_provider is not accounting,
namely allocations from evacuated instances (or incomplete migrations
though you can't migrate baremetal instances today), we could still
delete the compute service and orphan those in-use providers. That,
however, is no worse than before this change where we did not try
to cleanup all providers. The issue described above is being tracked
with bug 1829479 and will be dealt with separately.

Change-Id: I9e852e25ea89f32bf19cdaeb1f5dac8f749f5dbc
Closes-Bug: #1811726
"}]
commit_message:
Delete resource providers for all nodes when deleting compute service

Change I7b8622b178d5043ed1556d7bdceaf60f47e5ac80 started deleting the
compute node resource provider associated with a compute node when
deleting a nova-compute service. However, it would only delete the
first compute node associated with the service which means for an
ironic compute service that is managing multiple nodes, the resource
providers were not cleaned up in placement. This fixes the issue by
iterating all the compute nodes and cleaning up their providers.
Note this could be potentially a lot of nodes, but we don't really
have many good options here but to iterate them and clean them up
one at a time.

Note that this is best-effort but because of how the
SchedulerReportClient.delete_resource_provider method ignores
ResourceProviderInUse errors, and we could have stale allocations
on the host for which delete_resource_provider is not accounting,
namely allocations from evacuated instances (or incomplete migrations
though you can't migrate baremetal instances today), we could still
delete the compute service and orphan those in-use providers. That,
however, is no worse than before this change where we did not try
to cleanup all providers. The issue described above is being tracked
with bug 1829479 and will be dealt with separately.

Change-Id: I9e852e25ea89f32bf19cdaeb1f5dac8f749f5dbc
Closes-Bug: #1811726

commit_message:
Fix mon_host hosts when hostname contains 'ip'

Ceph-mon template script parse mon_host in wrong way, when
hostname contains'ip' word, e.g.: airship.

Change-Id: I0a097443d42ad2e9b6be6c61facd7932ddb4b3bb
Story: 2006255
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/88/671688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ENDPOINT=$(kubectl get endpoints ceph-mon -n ${NAMESPACE} -o json | awk -F'"' -v port=${MON_PORT} '/"ip"/{print $4":"port}' | paste -sd',')
deleted_lines: ENDPOINT=$(kubectl get endpoints ceph-mon -n ${NAMESPACE} -o json | awk -F'"' -v port=${MON_PORT} '/ip/{print $4":"port}' | paste -sd',')

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Story: #2005924

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

We use lxml which requires a number of underlying packages.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: Ie635fa5d613cb89f8de8c8c8d5b119621acb926d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/50/671450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:bindep] basepython = python3 # Do not install any requirements. We want this to be fast and work even if # system dependencies are missing, since it's used to tell you what system # dependencies are missing! This also means that bindep must be installed # separately, outside of the requirements files, and develop mode disabled # explicitly to avoid unnecessarily installing the checked-out repo too. deps = bindep commands = bindep test

commit_message:
use SqlFixture and StaticSqlFixture from neutron-lib

This patch uses neutron-lib's SqlFixture and StaticSqlFixture by
removing those fixtures from neutron and using them from neutron-lib
instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668000/

Change-Id: I0c28f7436a7a8797b6b226748f8b5de8f7636b7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/87/657887/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import fixture as lib_fixturesSqlFixture = lib_fixtures._SqlFixture StaticSqlFixture = lib_fixtures._StaticSqlFixture
deleted_lines: import fixturesfrom neutron_lib.db import model_basefrom oslo_db.sqlalchemy import enginefacadefrom oslo_db.sqlalchemy import sessionclass SqlFixture(fixtures.Fixture): """Base of a fixture which can create a schema and delete from its tables. """ @classmethod def _generate_schema(cls, engine): model_base.BASEV2.metadata.create_all(engine) def _delete_from_schema(self, engine): with engine.begin() as conn: for table in reversed( model_base.BASEV2.metadata.sorted_tables): conn.execute(table.delete()) def _init_resources(self): raise NotImplementedError() def _setUp(self): self._init_resources() # check if the fixtures failed to get # an engine. The test setUp() itself should also be checking # this and raising skipTest. if not hasattr(self, 'engine'): return engine = self.engine self.addCleanup(lambda: self._delete_from_schema(engine)) self.sessionmaker = session.get_maker(engine) _restore_factory = db_api.get_context_manager()._root_factory self.enginefacade_factory = enginefacade._TestTransactionFactory( self.engine, self.sessionmaker, from_factory=_restore_factory, apply_global=False) db_api.get_context_manager()._root_factory = self.enginefacade_factory engine = db_api.CONTEXT_WRITER.get_engine() self.addCleanup( lambda: setattr( db_api.get_context_manager(), "_root_factory", _restore_factory)) self.useFixture(EnableSQLiteFKsFixture(engine)) class EnableSQLiteFKsFixture(fixtures.Fixture): """Turn SQLite PRAGMA foreign keys on and off for tests. FIXME(zzzeek): figure out some way to get oslo.db test_base to honor oslo_db.engines.create_engine() arguments like sqlite_fks as well as handling that it needs to be turned off during drops. """ def __init__(self, engine): self.engine = engine def _setUp(self): if self.engine.name == 'sqlite': self.engine.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys=ON") def disable_fks(): with self.engine.connect() as conn: conn.connection.rollback() conn.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys=OFF") self.addCleanup(disable_fks) class StaticSqlFixture(SqlFixture): """Fixture which keeps a single sqlite memory database at the global scope. """ _GLOBAL_RESOURCES = False @classmethod def _init_resources(cls): # this is a classlevel version of what testresources # does w/ the resources attribute as well as the # setUpResources() step (which requires a test instance, that # SqlFixture does not have). Because this is a SQLite memory # database, we don't actually tear it down, so we can keep # it running throughout all tests. if cls._GLOBAL_RESOURCES: return else: cls._GLOBAL_RESOURCES = True cls.schema_resource = provision.SchemaResource( provision.DatabaseResource( "sqlite", db_api.get_context_manager()), cls._generate_schema, teardown=False) dependency_resources = {} for name, resource in cls.schema_resource.resources: dependency_resources[name] = resource.getResource() cls.schema_resource.make(dependency_resources) cls.engine = dependency_resources['database'].engine

commit_message:
Add rbd secret_uuid in secondary config

- Update initialize_connection to return active
backend connection data.
- Add secret_uuid support in secondary config

  For example:
  replication_device = backend_id:secondary,
                       conf:/etc/ceph/secondary.conf,
                       user:SECONDARY_UDER,
                       secret_uuid:SENDARY_SECRET_UUID

Closes-Bug #1828974

Change-Id: I1692310ef8ddc8ace88c4209fa447722ee422aaf

Add federated users to the groups that they receive from the mapping rules.
This membership is only carried by the token and not persisted in the
database. The membership expires, but can be renewed when the user
authenticates with the same group.

commit_message:
Expiring Group Membership Through Mapping Rules

Add federated users to the groups that they receive from the mapping rules.
This membership is only carried by the token and not persisted in the
database. The membership expires, but can be renewed when the user
authenticates with the same group.

Partial-Bug: 1809116

Change-Id: If376a1ce18f9b628f429f3cac957c76dacd00a34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/01/604201/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================= Renewable Application Credentials ================================= `bp refreshable-app-creds <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/refreshable-app-creds>`_ Allow creation of applications credentials based on the authorization of mapped group assignments. The application credentials will have an expiration time, which will require the user who created the application credential to log in with the same mapped group membership. Problem Description =================== Currently, federated users that receive their role assignments as part of mapping to groups, cannot create trusts or application credentials. Creation will fail saying that the user doesn't have the role. That is because that role assignment is only valid for the duration of their token, and not permanently added to the user. We cannot make either the role or the group membership permanent, because that user would then have those permissions even if they get removed in the external Identity Provider, either entirely or just from the group. Proposed Change =============== We propose to allow the creation of application credentials for users who receive their permission via mappings. These application credentials will have the roles that the user has at authentication time, however they will expire. They can be renewed however, if the user still has the same authorization at renew time. new api call POST `/v3/users/{user_id}/application_credentials/{application_credential_id}/refresh` Alternatives ------------ Do nothing and not allow application credentials for federated users. Currently, the only way to have application credentials, or trusts for federated users is to effectively grant them the role, rather than be mapped to it via group membership. Security Impact --------------- Since Keystone doesn't have access to the external identity provider to get notified when a users permissions are revoked, there will be a lag between when a user has their permissions revoked and their application credentials expire. During that time they will be able to log in, but unable to renew the application credential. Notifications Impact -------------------- A notification will be emitted when an application credential is renewed, or when an attempt to renew an application credential fails. Other End User Impact --------------------- Changes will be required to `python-keystoneclient` and `openstackclient`. Performance Impact ------------------ No performance impact. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- * New configuration option for `expiration_time`. Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: knikolla Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- TODO Dependencies ============ TODO Documentation Impact ==================== New documentation for the feature. References ========== TODO

commit_message:
Cleanup unused Postgres config values

This patch is part of an effort to cleanup the values.yaml file for
Postgres, which has gotten messy since the introduction of Patroni. This
patch specifically removes unused configuration values which were
causing unnecessary bloat and complexity.

Change-Id: I96180fd9c91200ba7558e58bd503b4ef9ebc183e

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I39ffc73bb12ba93432251d91def78031b2a2b1e9

Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like swift-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like trove-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

This is a proposal to configure resource provider visibility, ownership,
inventory, trait, and aggregate settings using a standardized YAML file
format.

Note: This work is derived from Jay’s Rocky provider-config-file
proposal [1] and Konstantinos’s device-placement-model spec [2] (which
is derived from Eric’s device-passthrough spec [3]), but differs in
several substantive ways.

Note: This is intended to define a *framework*. Subsequent features can
define the semantics by which the framework can be used to satisfy
particular use cases.

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2019-07-03 14:00:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/0936ef75b9fbc5be053eb5951b9314c06232e381', 'message': "Spec: Provider config YAML file

This is a proposal to configure resource provider visibility, ownership,
inventory, trait, and aggregate settings using a standardized YAML file format.

.. note:: This work is derived from `Jay's Rocky provider-config-file
          proposal`_ and `Konstantinos's device-placement-model spec`_ (which
          is derived from `Eric's device-passthrough spec`_), but differs in
          several substantive ways.

.. note:: This work is influenced by requirements to Nova to support non
          native compute resources that are managed by Resource Management
		  Daemon for finer grain control. PTG discussion notes available at
		  `Resource Management Daemon_PTG Summary`_

.. note:: We currently limit the ownership and consumption of the provider
          config YAML as described by the file format to Nova only.

.. note:: The provider config will currently only accept placement overrides
          to create and manage inventories and traits for resources not
		  natively managed by the Nova virt driver.

.. note:: This is intended to define a *framework* for currently active
		  usecases. Subsequent features can define the semantics by which the
		  framework can be used by consumers(besides Nova) or enhanced to
		  satisfy particular use cases.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550244/2/specs/rocky/approved/provider-config-file.rst
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591037/8/specs/stein/approved/device-placement-model.rst
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579359/10/doc/source/specs/rocky/device-passthrough.rst
[4] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005809.html

Change-Id: I3b3f3227bc8c0c6a1057122a3014131b1baf72a6
blueprint: provider-config-file
Signed-off-by: dakshinai <dakshina.ilangovan@intel.com>

commit_message:
Spec: Provider config YAML file

This is a proposal to configure resource provider visibility, ownership,
inventory, trait, and aggregate settings using a standardized YAML file format.

.. note:: This work is derived from `Jay's Rocky provider-config-file
          proposal`_ and `Konstantinos's device-placement-model spec`_ (which
          is derived from `Eric's device-passthrough spec`_), but differs in
          several substantive ways.

.. note:: This work is influenced by requirements to Nova to support non
          native compute resources that are managed by Resource Management
          Daemon for finer grain control. PTG discussion notes available at
	  `Resource Management Daemon_PTG Summary`_

.. note:: We currently limit the ownership and consumption of the provider
          config YAML as described by the file format to Nova only.

.. note:: The provider config will currently only accept placement overrides
          to create and manage inventories and traits for resources not
	  natively managed by the Nova virt driver.

.. note:: This is intended to define a *framework* for currently active
          usecases. Subsequent features can define the semantics by which the
	  framework can be used by consumers(besides Nova) or enhanced to
          satisfy particular use cases.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550244/2/specs/rocky/approved/provider-config-file.rst
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591037/8/specs/stein/approved/device-placement-model.rst
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579359/10/doc/source/specs/rocky/device-passthrough.rst
[4] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005809.html

Change-Id: I3b3f3227bc8c0c6a1057122a3014131b1baf72a6
blueprint: provider-config-file
Signed-off-by: dakshinai <dakshina.ilangovan@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/97/612497/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================== Provider Configuration File =========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/provider-config-file This is a proposal to configure resource provider visibility, ownership, inventory, trait, and aggregate settings using a standardized YAML file format. .. note:: This work is derived from `Jay's Rocky provider-config-file proposal`_ and `Konstantinos's device-placement-model spec`_ (which is derived from `Eric's device-passthrough spec`_), but differs in several substantive ways. Problem description =================== In order to facilitate the proper management of resource provider information in the placement API by external (to Nova) as well as internal agents, we require a way of expressing various overrides for resource provider information. While we could continue to use many existing and new configuration options for expressing this information, having a standardized, versioned provider descriptor file format allows us to decouple the management of provider information from the configuration of the service or daemon that manages said resource providers. Use Cases --------- Note that the file format/schema defined here is designed to accomodate the following use cases, but actually enabling the use cases is outside the scope of this blueprint and will be the subject of separate specs. Inventory Customization ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **An operator wishes to set allocation ratios for a set of compute nodes by setting the allocation ratios in a batch operation via an aggregate association. The operator expects that the ``nova-compute`` worker will not overwrite the allocation ratio they just set.** The file defined by this spec must allow its author to: * Identify a provider unambiguously, even if it does not yet exist in placement. * Customize any aspect of the provider's inventory, including resource classes, totals, min/max unit, step size, reserved amounts, and allocation ratios. * Associate a provider with one or more aggregates. Trait Customization ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **An operator wishes to indicate that even if the virt driver on a compute node discovers a certain CPU feature, it should not report such a trait to the placement API.** **An operator wishes to associate additional traits with a provider.** This is important if an operator wants to override a set of compute node's traits and not have the virt driver overwrite that information. The file defined by this spec must allow its author to: * Identify a provider unambiguously, even if it does not yet exist in placement. * Specify automatic traits which are to be removed from the provider. * Specify arbitrary traits which are to be to be associated with the provider. Device Passthrough ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **An admin wants to configure hosts and flavors to allow passthrough of devices to VMs.** Ideally this should accomodate: * Any level of granularity, from whole card to physical function to virtual function. * Any device type, including but not limited to PCI. * Any hypervisor's representation/identification/discovery of a device, e.g. not limited to D:B:S.F PCI addresses or visibility via sysfs. By building on the design outlined in this spec, we would like to be able to: * Deprecate and remove the existing ``[pci]passthrough_whitelist`` mechanism. (However, we do not necessarily intend to provide a 1:1 mapping from that mechanism.) * Rely on Placement to select/filter allocation candidates for scheduling purposes, thereby realizing improved scheduling performance and allowing us to: * Deprecate and remove the PciPassthroughFilter. Therefore the file defined by this spec must allow its author to: * Identify devices unambiguously such that consuming services (``nova-compute``, including virt drivers; ``cyborg``; etc.) can correlate them to what's discovered by the hypervisor. * Dictate whether a device is exposed - i.e. available for passthrough or not. * Configure/customize the inventory of a device: its resource class(es), reserved amounts, allocation ratios, etc. * Configure/customize the traits of a device. Collaborative Provider Tree Management ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **A Cyborg, Neutron ML2 or DHCP agent wants to create child resource providers under the parent compute node resource provider record and must be able to identify the compute node even if the ``nova-compute`` service worker has yet to create a resource provider record for the compute node in the placement API (or even before adding a record to the cell DB's ``compute_nodes`` table).** The file defined by this spec must allow its author to: * Describe a child provider, including unambiguously designating its parent provider without that parent necessarily yet existing in Placement. * Designate "ownership" of a provider, i.e. which service has the authority/responsibility to configure it. Sharing Providers ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **An admin wishes to identify, define, cause to be created, and schedule to a shared storage provider.** The file defined by this spec must allow its author to: * Describe/identify a sharing provider in such a way that it can be discovered/recognized as the same provider by multiple different compute nodes (potentially even on different platforms or hypervisor types). * Customize the inventory, traits, and aggregate associations of a sharing provider. NUMA ~~~~ **An admin wishes to be able to define a NUMA topology and schedule instances accordingly.** NUMA gets a special section all of its own. It's still very much unknown whether or how we're going to skin this cat, but one possibility using this file format would entail: * Identifying the compute node root provider and removing its inventory of ``VCPU``, ``MEMORY_MB``, and possibly other things like devices. * Defining (causing to be created) child/descendant providers representing NUMA nodes/affinity and designating their nesting hierarchy, inventories (of those resources removed from the compute node provider), traits, and aggregate associations. Proposed change =============== A versioned YAML file format with a formal schema is proposed. The scope of this spec is the schema, code to parse a file into a Python dict, and code to validate the dict against the schema. The code shall be introduced into the ``openstack/nova`` project initially, with the goal that it will soon be moved to a separate oslo-ish library. While this spec discusses some ways in which the file *could* be used, such usages are to be defined/described separately. The following is a simplified pseudo-schema for the file format. .. code-block:: yaml meta: # Version ($Major, $minor) of the schema must successfully parse documents # conforming to ($Major, 0..$minor). Any breaking schema change (e.g. # removing fields, adding new required fields, imposing a stricter pattern # on a value, etc.) must bump $Major. schema_version: $Major.$minor providers: # List of dicts - identification: # Identify some number of providers to configure. # At least one key is required. Multiple keys are ANDed. # No wildcarding or regexes in values (yet). # # UUID of the provider (as opposed to e.g. the UUID of the backing # resource, which may not be the same.) uuid: $uuid_pattern # Name of the provider (likewise). name: $string # Various addressing mechanisms. If the mechanism is n/a on a # particular system but the key is included, the code processing the # configuration should probably generate an error. pci_address: $pci_dbsf_pattern drc_index: $hex8_pattern drc_name: $string sysfs_path: $string # Various PCI fields, allowing identification aligned with # ``[pci]passthrough_whitelist`` (except no wildcarding). Values come # from ``lspci`` (libvirt), ``pvmctl ioslot list`` (PowerVM), ... pci_vendor_id: $hex4_pattern pci_product_id: $hex4_pattern pci_subsys_vendor_id: $hex4_pattern pci_subsys_product_id: $hex4_pattern pci_class: $hex4_pattern pci_revision_id: $hex2_pattern # Identify a provider by traits it has on it. It would be dangerous for # there to be overlap between these values and those in # ``providers[].customization.traits`` for *any* provider in the file. # Don't do that. traits: # AND.join(*all, OR.join(*any)) all: # List of trait names - $trait_pattern - ... any: # List of trait names - $trait_pattern - ... # Identify a provider by the aggregates to which it belongs. It would # be dangerous for there to be overlap between these values and those # in ``providers[].customization.aggregates`` for *any* provider in the # file. Don't do that. aggregates: # AND.join(*all, OR.join(*any)) all: # List of aggregate UUIDs. # REVIEWERS: Is there any other way we want to allow # identification of aggregates? - $uuid_pattern - ... any: # Ditto - $uuid_pattern - ... ownership: # Designate the service responsible for managing these providers. # REVIEWERS: Is this a service type (e.g. "compute") or a project # name (e.g. "nova")? service: $string passthrough: # For providers whose inventories represent devices (physical or # virtual), indicate whether they are allowed to be allocated and # passed through to instances. This could be accomplished by removing # all inventory, but this way you don't have to know what resource # class(es) are provided. # The owning service may decide to enforce ``allow: false`` by # removing the providers entirely, removing their inventories, # setting ``reserved = total``, etc. allow: $bool customization: # This section allows the admin to edit properties of the identified # provider(s). # # Set the provider name and/or UUID. Generally speaking, don't do # this. Not even sure we ought to support it at all. # Parser should error if any ``provider[].identification`` anywhere # in the file has the same name/uuid (because that'd be circular). # Consuming service should error if ``identification`` for this # ``provider[]`` item matches more than one provider (because that # would violate UUID/name uniqueness). name: $string uuid: $uuid_pattern # Designate these providers as child providers, parented by the # identified provider. Error if this does not identify exactly one # provider. Error of the providers already have a parent that isn't # the one identified (because reparenting is currently not allowed). parent_identification: ${include: providers[].identification} # Customize the providers' inventories inventories: add: # Inventory dicts keyed by resource class. # If inventory exists, it is replaced (because this needs to # be repeatable). # This could cause problems for e.g. the "reserved = total" # trick. $resource_class: # Fields not specified get defaults and/or are eligible # to be discovered by the owning service. total: $int reserved: $int min_unit: $int max_unit: $int step_size: $int allocation_ratio: $float ... patch: # As above, but fields not specified are left as-is in the # db. # Can result in overcommitted situations (which may have been # the intent, e.g. reserved = total). # Consuming service may wish to ignore or error on # inventories which are not found. remove: # List of resource class names. # If allocations exist, consuming service should error. # Inventories not found should be ignored (because this needs # to be repeatable). - $resource_class - ... rename: # Dict of string (desired resource class name) keyed by # original resource class name. # If inventory of keyed resource class is found, replace with # inventory of value. # Why is this better than add+remove? Because here you don't # have to know the inventory values. # Inventories not found should be ignored (because this needs # to be repeatable). # If allocations on the original resource class exist, the # consuming service may wish to ignore, error, or reshape. $resource_class_orig: $rc_name_pattern ... # Add or remove traits traits: add: - $trait_pattern - ... remove: # Remove otherwise-auto-generated traits from the provider. # Traits not found should be ignored (because this needs to # be repeatable). - $trait_pattern - ... # Add or remove aggregate associations aggregates: add: # List of aggregate UUIDs. # REVIEWERS: Is there any other way we want to allow # identification of aggregates? - $uuid_pattern - ... remove: # Ditto. # Aggregates not found should be ignored (because this needs # to be repeatable). - $uuid_pattern - ... # Next provider... - identification: ... Miscellaneous notes: * Each item in the ``providers`` list will identify a set of zero or more providers. Consuming services should generate an error if these sets are not mutually exclusive. * Let's make all the hex patterns (``$hexN_pattern``, ``$uuid_pattern``, ``$pci_dbsf_pattern``) case-insensitive. Alternatives ------------ Ad hoc provider configuration is being performed today through an amalgam of oslo.config options, more of which are being proposed or considered to deal with VGPUs, NUMA, bandwidth resources, etc. The awkwardness of expressing hierarchical data structures has led to such travesties as ``[pci]passthrough_whitelist`` and "dynamic config" mechanisms where config groups and their options are created on the fly. YAML is natively suited for this purpose as it is designed to express arbitrarily nested data structures clearly, with minimal noisy punctuation. In addition, the schema is self-documenting. `Jay's Rocky provider-config-file proposal`_ suggested that we should use one file per provider, rather than a single file for all providers. A single file is preferred because: * We can use a single config option to define the path to the file * We don't have to worry about file naming/discovery * It's easier to manage all providers in one place, particularly if deployment tools wish to use a common file across a cloud. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- Admins should ensure that provider config files have appropriate permissions and ownership. Consuming services may wish to check this and generate an error if a file is writable by anyone other than the process owner. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Admins *may* need to understand this file in order to use it appropriately. However, services should strive to behave sanely if the file is absent. Developer impact ---------------- Subsequent specs will be needed for services consuming this file format. Upgrade impact -------------- None. (Consumers of this file format will need to address this - e.g. decide how to deprecate existing config options which are being replaced.) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: efried Other contributors: kosamara? jaypipes? Work Items ---------- * Construct a formal schema * Implement parsing and schema validation * Compose a self-documenting sample file Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Schema validation will be unit tested. Documentation Impact ==================== The formal schema file and a self-documenting sample file are sufficient documentation for this spec. User-facing documentation (including release notes) will be the responsibility of consuming blueprints. References ========== .. _Jay's Rocky provider-config-file proposal: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550244/2/specs/rocky/approved/provider-config-file.rst .. _Konstantinos's device-placement-model spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591037/8/specs/stein/approved/device-placement-model.rst .. _Eric's device-passthrough spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579359/10/doc/source/specs/rocky/device-passthrough.rst History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Stein - Introduced

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I7dd8734b66a9cb704a69b3a76d7b3f8c52cbf6f0

commit_message:
sync: use proposal-bot + gerrit ssh API to pull projects

With the transition to OpenDev, we cannot rely on the old URLs
and this is a much cleaner solution that leverages the proposa-bot
user to get all the information we need.

Change-Id: Ie5dae335c12e178928186637b7b73f97c6a694ab
(cherry picked from commit 0f4872e8232063c1758f38834d1b99cfc4ac9c4e)
(cherry picked from commit 17a4ca8d839cee1f4224a345b3475641b89ed35c)

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting

For more information see the thread at

Change-Id: I451e4535b028b18dc9358701b5f3b3317daf2479

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I451e4535b028b18dc9358701b5f3b3317daf2479

Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html

Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I3a1fe5e065b9dbb218acdab06c1d1dac38ea7e64

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like sahara-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I74bda8876e0f043cd7362ab04fcdb74d24d35d72

commit_message:
Update Neutron grafana dashboard

Recently there was couple of changes in Neutron CI jobs config:

- [1] added new job "tempest-integrated-networking",
- [2] removed tempest-full and tempest-full-py3 jobs - those jobs are
  replaced with "tempest-integrated-networking" job,
- [3] added new non-voting job:
  tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-standalone

This patch reflects above changes in Neutron Grafana dashboard.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669815/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670717/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670029/

Change-Id: I01320361e6dc05b43f46451ef128116eb1aa3aa6

Convert dynamic includes to static imports

passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config

commit_message:
Nagios: Add elasticsearch python clients to image

This adds the elasticsearch and elasticsearch-dsl python client
packages to the Nagios image, so that they can be used to support
plugins and scripts for querying Elasticsearch directly

Change-Id: Ic235bf1409ee58aa49d299f07c27dc166b3b8c1f
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: Ic92c2c8172e4f2f9eca2b97e1c1d8cbf09dd167d

commit_message:
Followup for provider config file spec

Addresses the following on the provider-config-file spec:

- Adds a caution about how ironic nodes will be affected when they move
  from one compute host to another.
- Adds an implementation note for the schema since it was in my head.

Change-Id: Iea385d122675a341e0374223992e9a689049d04b
Blueprint: provider-config-file
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/49/671749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Either uuid or name is mandatory. (Implementation note: for schema # forward compatibility, use minProperties=1 rather than enforcing "uuid # or name" explicitly.) # NOTE: Caution should be exercised when identifying ironic nodes, # especially via the `$COMPUTE_NODE` special value. If an ironic node # moves to a different compute host with a different provider config, its # attributes will change accordingly.
deleted_lines: # Either uuid or name is mandatory.

commit_message:
Use systemd-journald instead of log files

This patch aims to migrate service from usage of regular syslog files
to journald.
By this we mean dropping rsyslog client installation. log_address is set
by default to /dev/log, which is served by journald.

Change-Id: I6dd0d77004394bb1ad674b53538b0679b056bb0f

commit_message:
Add a suffix for tmpwatch

Change 641608 introduces tmpwatch into logrotate-crond container.
However, LogrotatePurgeAfterDays parameter is parsed in hours because
there is no suffix to the value. This commit adds a suffix, 'd' to the

commit_message:
RHEL8 support for containers build

Apply kolla patch[1] to support rhel8, and create a base rhel
container with repos from rhui.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/669471

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/956

Change-Id: I9a18538a36a8b95ee4b6847993ef68963ebe27bc

commit_message:
Only validate admin and public host in local_subnet cidr

When multiple subnets are configured validations where failing
becuase the admin and public host addresses where checked
for all subnets. The admin and public host addresses should
only be validated against the cidr of the local_subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1791088
Change-Id: Ie9a6f88cc449c135593a0df0426e4d8054b38183
(cherry picked from commit c0c66a93c0641ebf591124cb05ee50e5ed5fda07)

commit_message:
Remove airship/berth from infra

This removes the airship/berth project from OpenStack Infra,
as agreed upon at the Denver PTG and in subsequent Airship
IRC team meetings.

The PS to zero-out the project has already merged:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670924/

Change-Id: Ibd6c51710bce82baa79d6733064f69f3f0e2c8e8

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I14bfdc0e488ffd2db1d0b82afd773674819ee0f4

commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: Ifc210d2fc7f217105d83c0ad4f86a3939c6c93d3

subject: sonobuoy: Support storing results on host
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-19 19:40:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-addons/commit/afa5a019f13cca5c27614202d47f8c1230a5dfca', 'message': 'sonobuoy: Support storing results on host

Currently, results are stored using an emptyDir volume. This change adds
support for storing results using a customizable hostPath. When storing
results in a hostPath, results can still be obtained form the hostPath
while result publishing is disabled.

Change-Id: Ibd01da23a8e74a54f500429cf0ba8ca72f2ac77d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-06-19 20:52:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-addons/commit/456da889cc6c9669bbf96056530a6bf9b303d11e', 'message': 'sonobuoy: Support storing results on host

Currently, results are stored using an emptyDir volume. This change adds
support for storing results using a customizable hostPath. When storing
results in a hostPath, results can still be obtained form the hostPath

commit_message:
sonobuoy: Support storing results on host

Currently, results are stored using an emptyDir volume. This change adds
support for storing results using a customizable hostPath. When storing
results in a hostPath, results can still be obtained form the hostPath
while result publishing is disabled.

Change-Id: Ibd01da23a8e74a54f500429cf0ba8ca72f2ac77d

deleted_lines: - emptyDir: {} name: sonobuoy-output

subject: Convert dynamic includes to static imports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-19 12:37:27.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_zun/commit/d4e79eb38f142ec8228a1042fb42ceec170cc331', 'message': 'Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I7c4c7e6887cc756998ce028355402705a45e18ed
(cherry picked from commit 373e2d3042713ed8c1f4c9a47c435e0d18f0a103)
'}]
commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task/role files are included using include_tasks, tags are not
passed to the included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config
do not have the intended effect. This patch changes include_tasks
to import_tasks for all cases where dynamic vars or loops are not used
so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I7c4c7e6887cc756998ce028355402705a45e18ed
(cherry picked from commit 373e2d3042713ed8c1f4c9a47c435e0d18f0a103)

commit_message:
nova-lxd: noop jobs as part of project retirement

noop job definitions for master branch as part of project
retirement; stable branches will be maintained for some
time so zuul configuration will be applied directly to each
branch to re-enable testing.

Change-Id: I91e0e27adc12572d23596ba74529ee0ba5e66a9b

commit_message:
Fix - L3 Conntrack Helper validator

'type:string' is validated by length, the definition was
passing in validators.validate_string instead of a number.
In python3 this causes a TypeError:
 '>' not supported between instances of 'int' and 'function'

Set the length to 64, matching the db model:
https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/master/neutron/db/models/conntrack_helper.py#L32

Related-Bug: #1823633
Change-Id: Idd9b442a30de294ce3fc97069cadba4457d746ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/28/671528/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'validate': {'type:string': 64},
deleted_lines: 'validate': {'type:string': validators.validate_string},

commit_message:
Add integrated coverage

Currently this role doesn't test the integrated jobs.
With the dynamic execution of the roles, this role
also get tested by the integrated repo.

commit_message:
Add possibility to disable running stadium projects tests

This patch adds possibility to disable running of tests related to:
* networking-bgpvpn,
* neutron-fwaas,
* networking-sfc

which were moved to neutron-tempest-plugin repo recently.
This will be useful when tests will be run for one of
stable branches up to Stein, in which those tests are still
in project's repo.

Change-Id: I61dc252920154e7e0998eb2c7c1f026814796cdf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/97/671297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(SfcScenarioTest, cls).skip_checks() msg = None if not CONF.sfc.run_sfc_tests: msg = ("Running of SFC related tests is disabled in " "plugin configuration.") if msg: raise cls.skipException(msg)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-19 11:22:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/functional.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/0c154991cebeab0abfd2499f95dc704ef046e09f', 'message': 'Use the database data backend in functional tests

Change-Id: I168378c0da0fdff493ee10ac6afef805da7cb9a5
'}]
commit_message:
Use the database data backend in functional tests

This allows testing real introspection data, not mocked swift.

Change-Id: I168378c0da0fdff493ee10ac6afef805da7cb9a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/06/671706/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: store_data = database def call_get_data(self, uuid, **kwargs): return self.call('get', '/v1/introspection/%s/data' % uuid, **kwargs).json() def test_stored_data_processing(self): data = self.call_get_data(self.uuid) self.assertEqual(self.data['inventory'], data['inventory']) new_data = copy.deepcopy(self.data) new_data['inventory']['cpu']['count'] = 42 res = self.call_reapply(self.uuid, data=new_data) data = self.call_get_data(self.uuid) self.assertEqual(42, data['inventory']['cpu']['count']) def test_edge_state_transitions(self): def test_lldp_plugin(self): updated_data = self.call_get_data(self.uuid)
deleted_lines: from ironic_inspector.common import swift @mock.patch.object(swift, 'store_introspection_data', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(swift, 'get_introspection_data', autospec=True) def test_stored_data_processing(self, get_mock, store_mock): cfg.CONF.set_override('store_data', 'swift', 'processing') # ramdisk data copy # please mind the data is changed during processing ramdisk_data = json.dumps(copy.deepcopy(self.data)) get_mock.return_value = ramdisk_data # reapply request data get_mock.assert_called_once_with(self.uuid, suffix='UNPROCESSED') # store ramdisk data, store processing result data, store # reapply processing result data; the ordering isn't # guaranteed as store ramdisk data runs in a background # thread; hower, last call has to always be reapply processing # result data store_ramdisk_call = mock.call(mock.ANY, self.uuid, suffix='UNPROCESSED') store_processing_call = mock.call(mock.ANY, self.uuid, suffix=None) self.assertEqual(3, len(store_mock.call_args_list)) self.assertIn(store_ramdisk_call, store_mock.call_args_list[0:2]) self.assertIn(store_processing_call, store_mock.call_args_list[0:2]) self.assertEqual(store_processing_call, store_mock.call_args_list[2]) get_mock.return_value = ramdisk_data # reapply saves the result self.assertEqual(4, len(store_mock.call_args_list)) self.assertEqual(store_processing_call, store_mock.call_args_list[-1]) res = self.call_reapply(self.uuid, data=copy.deepcopy(self.data)) @mock.patch.object(swift, 'store_introspection_data', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(swift, 'get_introspection_data', autospec=True) def test_edge_state_transitions(self, get_mock, store_mock): cfg.CONF.set_override('store_data', 'swift', 'processing') # ramdisk data copy # please mind the data is changed during processing ramdisk_data = json.dumps(copy.deepcopy(self.data)) get_mock.return_value = ramdisk_data @mock.patch.object(swift, 'store_introspection_data', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(swift, 'get_introspection_data', autospec=True) def test_lldp_plugin(self, get_mock, store_mock): cfg.CONF.set_override('store_data', 'swift', 'processing') ramdisk_data = json.dumps(copy.deepcopy(self.data)) get_mock.return_value = ramdisk_data # Verify that the lldp_processed data is written to swift # as expected by the lldp plugin updated_data = store_mock.call_args[0][0]
